article.headline: Georgia Southern 88, Fort Valley State 63
article.story: STATESBORO, Ga. (AP) -- Jean Francois led all scorers with 17 points and had 10 rebounds in his fifth double-double of the season Thursday night in Georgia Southern's 88-63 victory over Fort Valley State. The Eagles (5-6) opened the game by scoring the first eight points and the lead grew to 12-3 with 15:52 left in the half before the Wildcats (2-5) came back to tie it 22-22 with just over eight minutes remaining. Georgia Southern used a 24-7 run to claim the lead for good, holding a 46-29 advantage at halftime. Elton Nesbitt added 13 points, Donte Gennie 11, and Anthony Marshall 10 for Georgia Southern. Kendall Ruffin led Fort Valley with 16 points, while Ray Northern scored 14. Ruffin's free throw to open the second half pulled Fort Valley to within 16, but Georgia Southern scored the next seven points to push its lead to 53-30. The Wildcats closed to within no more than 20 the remainder of the game while the Eagles led by as much as 32, at 80-48 with 5:29 to go.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
